title: PennDOT considering plans to overhaul busy interchange in Aliquippa
description: PennDOT says the project could cost up to $19 million, with a projected start date in the spring of 2027.
content:
Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience.

Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience.

Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience. Generate Key Takeaways

Changes may be on the horizon for Route 51 (Constitution Boulevard) and the Route 3016 Franklin Avenue interchange in Aliquippa.

PennDOT says the potential changes will allow for safer access to downtown Aliquippa and the Aliquippa Industrial Park.

Aliquippa Mayor Dwan Walker says he would like to see the Route 51 land bridge demolished, and then the creation of an intersection with traffic lights.

“I’m born and raised here, 50 years of my life. I’ve been here and this has been a headache for the city as a whole and it’s residents,” Walker said. “It’s an all-hands-on-deck callout to get this done.”

Walker says this redesign could help open up Aliquippa and spur economic growth.

“Instead of just passing Aliquippa, you can actually take a visit to us,” Walker said.

Walker says the busy intersection gives drivers little space to accelerate and decelerate, including trucks from the industrial park. Walker says the intersection is also a prime spot for speeding.

Walter says these changes are a matter of life and death.

“We’ve had countless accidents, a loss of life, NyKasia Johnson. She lost her life and the goal is to name this street after her, to honor her,” said Walker.

PennDOT says the project could cost up to $19 million, with a projected start date in the spring of 2027.

PennDOT and Walker encourage the public to voice their opinions on the proposed changes here.

Follow Channel 11 News on Facebook and Twitter. | Watch WPXI NOW
summary: PennDOT is considering plans to overhaul a busy interchange in Aliquippa, Pennsylvania, using AI to generate takeaways that may not always match what's in the article. The changes could allow for safer access to downtown Alivippa and the Aliquipa Industrial Park, according to the Department of Transportation (PennDot). The project could cost up to $19 million and is expected to start in 2027. The public has been urged to voice their opinions on the proposed changes.
shortSummary: PennDOT is considering major changes to Aliquippa's busy Route 51 and 3016 Franklin Avenue interchange to improve safety, economic growth, and traffic safety.

scraped_sources.text:
Project Status
Step 2 of 4
Design
Next Step: Construction
Public Outreach
In-Person Public Meeting
A public meeting featuring a public plans display and project presentation was held on August 5, 2025 at Aliquippa High School (100 Harding Avenue, Aliquippa, PA 15001).
Project Overview
County: Beaver
Municipality: City of Aliquippa
State Routes: Route 51 & Route 3016
Local Names: Constitution Boulevard & Franklin Avenue
Project Type: Safety/Interchange Improvement
MPMS Number: 102661
Proposed Construction Start: Spring 2027
Proposed Construction End: Fall 2029
Last Updated: 08/07/2025
Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT) is working with Beaver County Corporation for Economic Development (BCCED) and the City of Aliquippa on an Alternative Study of the Route 51 Constitution Boulevard and Route 3016 Franklin Avenue interchange. This interchange is located in the City of Aliquippa, Beaver County, Pennsylvania. The alternative study aims to modernize the existing interchange to current design standards. The project scope of work will address existing geometric deficiencies and improve roadway continuity. This will provide safer access to downtown Aliquippa and to the Aliquippa Industrial Park.
Traffic Detour
It is anticipated that detours will be needed to complete construction. At this time, the detours are unknown as we are currently in study phase.

argos_summary: PennDOT is planning improvements to the Route 51 and Route 3016 interchange in Aliquippa to enhance safety and access to downtown and the industrial park. Mayor Dwan Walker advocates for the demolition of the Route 51 land bridge and the installation of traffic lights to reduce accidents and promote economic growth. The project, estimated to cost up to $19 million, is set to begin in spring 2027, with public input encouraged during the planning phase.
